name: Phyllis Boyens
description:
'''Phyllis S. Boyens''' (February 22, 1947 – December 9, 2009), also known as '''Phyllis Liptak''', was an American folk singer and actress. Her music was in the genre of "Mountain Music", also known as [[Appalachian music]]. She was the daughter of American [[folk singer]] and coal miner [[Nimrod Workman]].

In 1976 she appeared in the [[Academy Award]]–winning documentary ''[[Harlan County, USA]]'' with her father. In 1980 she starred in another Academy Award-winning film, ''[[Coal Miner's Daughter (film)|Coal Miner's Daughter]]''. In the film she played the role of Clara Webb, the mother of the character [[Loretta Lynn]].
